bibl.title: Despatch from Alexander G. Clark to William F. Wharton, January 29, 1891
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: Transmitting of Quarterly returns from Elmina

No 6. Consulate at Elmina January 6th 1891 viz 3 copies of arrivals and depatches of American vessels: 3 copies of summary of business for the quarter ending December 31st 1890 3 copies of return of trade with the United States with the Gold Coast Colon for the year, 1890 3 Detailed Reports of Official Services & & &
No 10 Dispatch Consul Series: Legation of the United States: Monrovia Liberia January 29, 1891:
To the Honorable William F. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State Washington D. C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to transmit the accounts and returns of the consul Agent at Elmina (Mr Geo E. Eminsang) for the quarter edning December 31st 1890. Viz: 12 enclosures in triplicates as follows enclosures No 1 Arrivals and Departures of American vessels. one copy I enclose to you one copy to the 5th Auditor of the treasury and one copy reserved for the Legation: No 2 Summary of Business for the quarter do. No 3. Return of Trade with the United States Showing the transports.

and exports betwene the United States and the Gold Coast Colony for the year 1890. Do,, No 4. Detailed Report of Official Service & c Marked 13 Do.. I further enclose a varbatim copy of Consul Agent Eminsang letter accompaning the enclosure Per No 5.. No 5 enclosure and call your notice to the fact that said letter was dated at Elmina Jany 6st 1891, and received at this legation January 29 inst which shows the poor and irregular mail facilitiys we enjoy having only one mail inward and outward, bound every fortnight and after every three weeks.
I have the honor to be sir: your obedient servant
Alexander Clark Minister Resident and Consul general of the US
